reviews.review: This and the original Portal are my all time favorite games. Highly recommend.

Portal was a fun game. It's simple controls and puzzle-based gameplay was something I hadn't seen in a first-person-shooter. Replacing enemies with lateral thinking, weapons with a portal gun, and all the anatagonists with a hyper-intelligent.
Portal 2, however, doesn't just leave off where Portal ended. It takes where Portal ended and blows it up like the deathstar. I mean, it's one of those rare sequals that just leaves the original in the dust. 

Waking up years after the first ends; the facility is in major disarray and GlaDOS is awake and still on a mission to kill you; for science! Rather than just a few puzzle rooms; this game has an entire facility. You finally get the unimaginable scope of how big the center was. And just when you think the game is over and you've defeated GlaDOS; well, the game is just getting started. 

It's a game that redefined gaming; how you can take a bunch of really cool concepts and build not just a game out of it; but an entire world. Everyone's raved about this game, and for good reason; it's *THAT* good. It's also relatively family friendly; a rarity in todays gaming world. There's no real blood; you don't shoot anything  but Portals; and the only time you die is when computerized turrets shoot you. Replace the violence for complex puzzles, add a big old glob of humor and you get Portal 2.

Buy it; play it. If you don't like it, then you're not a human.

The game is near impossible at times yet is easy once you figure it out. You never can figure it out. This game is challenging and humorous at many times, and has a coop mode perfect for expirimenting with your friends. It also has a customization system similar to TF2, where u can customized both Atlas and P-body seperatly. A good buy for lovers of the Portal franchise, Valve fanboys, guys with a few braincells to spare on hard puzzles or all of the above.

Ele não é perfeito como o primeiro, mas é quase, apesar de eu gostar mais desse do que o primeiro Portal. A História melhora muito, com 2 novos personagens ótimos, um ótimo jogo, mas recomendo que joguem o primeiro antes. Portal 1 e 2 são ótimos jogos.

This game is awesome.  Where the first game feels like it takes forever to get both portals for the portal gun, this one you get it right away.  It's also incredible to play through the game and watch the levels get rebuilt as you go.  It really puts you in the moment.

The banter coming from CONTROL is hilarious.  It's even funnier if you've played through Portal 1 before playing Portal 2.
Good Game. Es Muy Bueno

Best game ever made. Immersive. Puzzles. Portals. Philosophical questions.
The soundtrack is just perfect.
You ARE the character. And the game lets you live it that way.
And here, science is for women, too.
The campaign is not that long, but I hope that just like me, you rethink certain things and opinions in your life after completing it.
The multiplayer campaign is fun, but acts more like a filler. The map editor is really interesting, but you got to have the talent and free time for that. For endless portals fun, there are tons of fan made maps really worth a shot at the workshop.

Es un excelente juego, buenas graficas y lugares diversos, algunos complejos, creativos y por ejemplo, el centro de pruebas de Aperture Science (Espacial) donde te entrena Cave, me provoco un gran apuro en el juego porque no me agradaba estar debajo de Aperture, ademas de ser un poco feo el lugar. Esa sensacion me encanto, por eso mismo y muchas otras cosas que tiene Portal 2, el cooperativo, las torretas :T y GLaDOS, simplemente me encantaron. Lo recomiendo mucho
Great game alot of fun co-op.

The sequel to 2007's Game of the Year, and this time there are whole new challenges to complete.

Once again it is set in Aperture laboratries, with the maniacal GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) trying to kill you as you complete test chambers.

Singleplayer campaign
Chell (the character you play as) wakes up in an Aperture relaxation vault, and a robotic voice asks you to do certain actions. This is by far one of the best tutorials I have ever seen, as it manages to add this stage somewhat into the story. You head back to bed and are woken up again after what the computer states as "9-9-9-9-9-9-9... years", to find someone knocking on the door. You open it and find a small robot sphere named Wheatley, and this is where the real journey begins.

Multiplayer (or co-operative) campaign
You play as one of two robots, Atlas or P-body; with your partner playing as the other. It is set after the singleplayer campaign, and challenges you to think in an entirely different way. It features the same testing elements, but completely new test chambers. Unfortunately, when playing co-op on Mac or PC, you require a friend who also has bought Portal 2 to play this mode (unless you have a controller, but split-screen on a computer monitor is awful). [b]WARNING:[/b] you're co-op partner [i]may[/i] (highly likely) have a habit of dying. A lot.

Unlike Portal, Portal 2 has a much longer story and a more complicated plot. But don't let this scare you, as the plot has only a few things going on at a time.
Also, there are many new testing elements, such as:
- Hard-light bridges
- Excursion funnels
- Thermal discouragement beams
- Aerial faith plates
- Repulsion gel
- Propulsion gel
- and conversion gel

I thoroughly enjoyed this game, and it has plenty of things to make you come back, like hidden secrets and achievements, and a level editor that lets you create your own test chambers using many of the features available.

For a list of Portal 2's many awards, go [url=http://thinkwithportals.com/awards.php]here[/url].
The official website of Portal 2 is [url=http://thinkwithportals.com]http://thinkwithportals.com[/url].
Very amussing to play, and the puzzles are fairly challenging. Buy it, or I'll burn your house down...with lemons!
There's me life and personality in two robots and one voice recording than nearly any game I've ever played. This puts even movies to shame. Also puzzles. I guess that's a thing too.

Excelente juego, no soy de jugar demasiado pero este ha sido uno de los mejores con los que me he topado, la banda sonora es increible y los mapas e historia que realmente te meten en el juego, lo recomiendo sin ninguna duda.

Valve lo vuelve a hacer.
ya nos sorprendieron con el original portal, la primera parte del juego del que hablamos, y, creo que no soy el único que lo piensa, que fue un auténtico golpe en la mesa ante el ya saturado mercado de secuelas faltas de imaginación y FPS(first person shooter) en el que pocas joyas consiguen deslumbrar al público, la suerte se puso de parte de Valve y aquella maravilla, tanto técnica como jugable fue un exito, antes de esta maravilla pudimos ver el inolvidable half-life 2( y esperemos que un dia veamos el 3) y eso si que fue una revolución tanto por sus físicas ,su historia y su jugabilidad(gran aspecto que comparte con portal) pero con portal 2, vuelven a hacerlo, la jugabilidad no se altera, sino que se mantiene y se añaden novedosos elementos que hacen que no parezca un juego de niños pequeños, no insulta a nuestra inteligencia, la historia podría ser el punto fuerte del juego(si no lo es), debido en su mayor parte a GLaDOS, un personaje que sera recordado durante años, el juego posee una duración sobresaliente, superando ampliamente la de su predecesor, y los escenarios rebosan originalidad, pero una de las cosas que mas me llaman la atención, es Chell(el personaje protagonista), del cual, al desconocerlo casi todo sobre ella, hace que el juego rebose más misterio y que tengas que descubrirlo a medida que juegas, en resumén, portal 2 es una obra maestra que merece un museo, (eso sin mencionar las incontables cámaras de pruebas descargables), compralo cuando tengas la oportunidad, y veras, que este juego es un verdadero portal a otra dimensión.
Genial juego. La historia es fantástica, los puzles son entretenidos y difíciles (algunos) y el doblaje es el mejor que he visto en un videojuego. 10/10
